Summary: Star like object in sky but has colour & form when zoomed in.
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Gold Coast
There were no other sightings in Gold Coast on or around August 1st 2008
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsquick explanation. i had just purchased a new telescopic camera lens (a canon ef 70-300mm is usm with image stabilizer) and decided to go outside in the front yard and play with it, take a few photos of the dog, plants etc, then noticed the clouds had really beautiful rainbow shimmers to them, so started taking photos of the clouds. i noticed when sighting through the viewfinder, a bright dot to one side of the cloud. i intially thought it was a plane, extremely high up, but then noticed that it wasn't moving, the clouds were, and the clouds actually passed behind the object. i had also thought it maybe a star\planet until the cloud moved behind it. i watched it for about 15-20mins and it did not move. it did not get smaller or larger, which it would have if it was moving away or toward me, and i wasn't having to track it with the camera. i called my son out to have a look but you couldn't see it with the naked eye, and then i couldn't find it again through the viewfinder. anyway, i downloaded to the computer, and when you 'zoom in' on the object it is definitely not a plane shape, and even though very close up it pixelates, you can see it is greyish and has form. you can also make out a kind of heat shimmer or energy shimmer around the object, though this could be due to having to zoom in so close. i would really appreciate your opinion on what it could be, as i have shown my son, who has a bachelor of science, majoring in maths and physics (and very 'logical'), and he is totally stumped, and i have spent the last few days trying to work out what logical explanation there could be for this object, but have not found a one.
